law.catch_line: Use of electronic equipment for security functions -- Precautionary procedures when bomb, explosive or deadly weapon suspected.
law.text: An air board may utilize electronic equipment or such techniques and procedures as it determines necessary to insure the safety of the public on airplanes and on airport property from persons using or attempting to use bombs, explosives, firearms or other deadly weapons. When a bomb, explosive or other deadly weapon is detected on airport property, or there is good reason to suspect that an individual may have such a device or weapon that he is attempting to conceal from proper authorities, a law enforcement officer, airline employee or air board agent or employee may take prudent and necessary precautionary measures to protect individual lives and property.
law.history: Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 26, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1982.
